CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL of the LAW provides :
“ CARDINAL . Access to the law and to the courts to defend CARDINAL ’s rights and legitimate interests is guaranteed to all . ORG can not be refused for lack of financial resources .
CARDINAL . Everyone is entitled , in accordance with the law , to information , legal advice and legal aid . ”
CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL of the LAW provides :

“ Every person charged with a criminal offence is entitled to choose a legal representative and to be assisted by him in all procedural steps . The law shall lay down the circumstances in which and the stages at which such assistance is compulsory . ”
CARDINAL . The relevant provisions of LAW are the following :
“ CARDINAL . The accused may instruct counsel at any stage of the proceedings .

CARDINAL . Where it is provided by law that the accused must be represented and the accused has not appointed or does not propose to appoint a person to defend him , the judge shall assign CARDINAL officially , preferably a member or trainee member of the Bar ; but the officially assigned representative shall cease to have authority to act if the accused instructs counsel of his own choosing .

“ The accused may revoke any act carried out on his behalf by the person defending him , provided that he expressly declares that intention before any decision has been taken in respect of the act in question . ”
“ CARDINAL . The assistance of a representative is compulsory
( a ) when an accused in custody is first examined by the judge ;
( b ) during the investigation and at the hearing , except in proceedings which can not entail a custodial sentence or a preventive measure ;

( c ) for any step in the proceedings if the accused is deaf , dumb or illiterate or does not know NORP , if he is under the age of DATE or if the issue of his lack of criminal responsibility or his diminished responsibility has been raised ;
“ CARDINAL . Where a representative is assigned officially , the accused shall be notified of the fact if he was not present at the material time .
CARDINAL . The officially assigned representative may be excused from assisting the accused if he puts forward a ground that the court considers valid .
CARDINAL . The court may replace the officially assigned representative at any time on an application by the accused that contains a valid ground .
CARDINAL . Until such time as he is replaced , an officially assigned representative shall continue to act in respect of subsequent steps in the proceedings .

CARDINAL . The representative shall always be remunerated for his services ; the terms and the amount shall be determined by the court , within the limits laid down in a scale approved by ORG or , failing that , in the light of the fees normally paid for services of a similar nature and of equal importance .
Payment shall be the responsibility of , as the case may be , the accused , the assistente , the civil parties or ORG . ”

CARDINAL . If the representative is replaced during the judicial investigation or the hearing , the court may , of its own motion or on an application by the new representative , grant a pause to enable the new representative to consult with the accused and study the file .

CARDINAL . Instead of the pause mentioned in the preceding paragraphs the court may decide , where absolutely necessary , to adjourn the relevant step in the proceedings or the hearing , provided , however , that such an adjournment shall not exceed DATE . ”
“ CARDINAL . To be valid , all steps in the proceedings , whether written or oral , must be made in LANGUAGE .
CARDINAL . Where a person who can not understand or speak NORP has to take part in proceedings , an appropriate interpreter shall be appointed free of charge …
CARDINAL . An interpreter shall likewise be appointed if it proves necessary to translate a document in a foreign language which is not accompanied by a certified translation .

“ An accused , even if at liberty , may submit observations , pleadings or applications at any stage of the proceedings , even if they are not signed by his representative , provided that they relate to the subject matter of the proceedings or are intended to protect his fundamental rights . Such observations , pleadings or applications shall always be placed in the case file . ”

“ CARDINAL . The purpose of the judicial investigation shall be to provide judicial confirmation of the indictment or of the decision whereby proceedings in the case have been discontinued , so that the case may go to trial or not .
CARDINAL . The judicial investigation shall be optional … ”
“ CARDINAL . A judicial investigation may be applied for within DATE from the serving of the indictment or of the decision to discontinue the proceedings
by the accused , in relation to facts covered by the indictment drawn up by the public prosecutor ’s office , or by the assistente if the criminal proceedings have been brought by the latter ;
CARDINAL . Such an application may only be dismissed if it is out of time , if the judge has no jurisdiction or if a judicial investigation is statutorily inadmissible .

CARDINAL . The application shall not have to satisfy any formal requirements but it must contain a summary of the reasons of fact and law for challenging the indictment or the failure to bring an indictment , together with , if appropriate , some indication either of the judicial investigation measures which the applicant would like to see taken and of any evidence not considered during the preliminary inquiries or of facts which it is hoped to prove by such means . ”
“ CARDINAL . The pleadings shall set forth in detail the grounds of appeal and end with submissions , set out point by point , in which the appellant summarises the reasons for his appeal .

the legal provisions that have been infringed ;
